page.title: 17GREEN HAMMERTON SCHOOL.
page.content: Our school was built in l874. It is made of brick with stone facings. There is a steep pitched roof and porch with tiles. Once there was just one room with a fire. You can still see the chimney, the open beams and the pretty bell tower with tall slim spire which once had a weathervane that worked but now it is stuck. The spire can be seen from far away. There is also now another modern classroom added after the war where the infants live, and a double temporary unit which we use as a hall but once there were two more classes in there. We also have a lovely big field to play football and dens. On the other side of the main building is a playground with netball posts and bars to play on and a sandpit where the infants play at being engineers, tunnelling and digging. There are 27 children.
